query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Report and Updated Strategy and Plan
result.description: This document will update the dissemination and communication strategy plan as appropriate and report on year1 activities. It will also include input coming from task 4.2 about what have been the most effective communication tools and channels in terms of community reach, and report on activities pursued to grow the CAPS community and engagement of stakeholders.

result.title: Knowledge transfer roadmap
result.description: This deliverable is the outcome of Task 2.1, namely the analysis of the CAPS projects and Internet Science in general. It will inform the methodology workshops in WP3 and, hence, will be available at month 6, to be further used and taken up for Task 3.1 at month 7.

result.description: A dedicated project website will be functional in three months after the project start and will be regularly maintained. result.title: Initial Exploitation Plan for Civic Open Data Engagement
result.description:
Initial Exploitation Plan for Civic Open Data Engagement (report, M12)
This deliverable considers different exploitation aspects of our technical and process innovation beyond the scope of the project: Market potential and business plan, transferability and sustainability.
The initial exploitation plan will provide an outline for our exploitation and business plan based on the insights from our first co-creation activities in UK and Germany. This outline will present the structure according to which the market potential will be further analysed. In addition TT will outline an agreement for how to collaborate among the partners concerning IPR.
The task will be led by TT in collaboration with FTB, AUTH, UPM, ULANC, ifib, RCM and ZAR.

result.title: D7.1 Identification of promising applications for EO for land system science and sustainability science based on a user consultation workshop
result.description: Identification of promising applications for EO for land system science and sustainability science based on a user consultation workshop. Requirements for EO data products will be identified, and the potential of existing, and in particular novel BACI data products will be discussed.

result.title: Evaluation of sensors to be used in the steel industry
result.description: This deliverable will report on the evaluation of inline sensors in the steel industry. This evaluation will include the the requirement analysis for the cases of material handling and BF processes, applicability of sensors in different materials, sustainability of sensors agains temperatures and gas atmospheres, and wireless methods for establishing data connections. Finally, an application strategy will be presented towards the implementation of the proposed sensors in the experimental BF.

result.title: Website and social media feeds online
result.description: Website and social media feeds online. A project’s website will be published by month 3, in order to raise awareness about the project’s activities. All the website content will be promoted via social media (mainly linkedin and twitter) and electronic newsletter Social media engagement will be sought also through the launch of initiatives such as hashtags to engage with the general public, surveys and spontaneous public consultations among social media users (mainly Linkedin, Twitter). This will be completed between months 1 and 3 and refers to task 9.3

result.title: Performance results of char for generation of energy through gasification
result.description: Performance results of char for generation of energy through gasification Tests using biochar will be performed in a pilot scale updraft gasifier located at Fraunhofer Syngas compositional analysis calorific value tar formation and gasifier performance will be monitored and recorded to determine the feasibility of using char from organic wastes as a fuel for gasifiers To be completed between months 41 and 59 Refers to task 46
